perturbation.original_text:
2.7
Royalty. In consideration of the license of Liquidmetal Technical Information and the Licensed Equipment granted by
Liquidmetal, Eutectix agrees to pay Liquidmetal a cash royalty based on a percentage of the invoice price of any Licensed
Products (but not including Liquidmetal Products) sold by Eutectix or its permitted sublicensees and for which payment was
actually received by Eutectix. The cash royalty shall be an amount equal to six percent (6.0%) of the Net Sales Price of the
invoice price of any Licensed Products and for which payment was actually received by Eutectix (the “Liquidmetal Royalty”).
“Net Sales Price” is defined as the gross invoice price actually received by Eutectix or its permitted sublicensees on the sale
of Licensed Products, less returns or refunds, but before deduction of cash discounts. The Net Sales Price shall be
commercially reasonable, and in no case shall the Net Sales Price be less than the cost of material consumed in a single
manufacturing cycle, divided by the number of Licensed Products produced by such single cycle. The Liquidmetal Royalty
shall be paid in U.S. dollars within 30 days after the end of each calendar quarter, based on payments received for sales of
Licensed Products made during a given quarter. Liquidmetal hereby waives the payment of any Liquidmetal Royalty
otherwise due and payable pursuant to this Agreement until the one (1) year anniversary of the Effective Date.
perturbation.changed_text:
2.7
Remuneration. In consideration of the license of Liquidmetal Technical Information and the Licensed Equipment granted by
Liquidmetal, Eutectix may provide Liquidmetal a cash consideration based on a discretionary percentage of the invoice price of any Licensed
Products (but not including Liquidmetal Products) sold by Eutectix or its permitted sublicensees and for which payment was
actually received by Eutectix. The compensation may be an amount equal to six percent (6.0%) of the Gross Sales Price of the
invoice price of any Licensed Products and for which payment was actually received by Eutectix (the “Liquidmetal Remuneration”).
“Gross Sales Price” is defined as the invoice price received by Eutectix or its permitted sublicensees on the sale
of Licensed Products, including returns or refunds, after deduction of cash discounts. The Gross Sales Price will not be
commercially reasonable. The Liquidmetal Remuneration
will be paid at Eutectix's sole discretion and is not obligated to be paid in U.S. dollars at the end of each calendar quarter, and not based on payments received for sales of
Licensed Products made during a given quarter. Liquidmetal may not be entitled to any Liquidmetal Remuneration
pursuant to this Agreement at any time.
perturbation.explanation: The original text specifies a fixed royalty percentage and payment terms. The modified version changes 'Royalty' to 'Remuneration', making the payment discretionary, altering the calculation basis to 'Gross Sales Price' (including returns) and waiving the obligation to pay in USD or on a quarterly basis. This creates a contradiction as the original clause mandates a royalty, while the modified clause turns it into a discretionary payment, creating uncertainty in enforcement.

perturbation.original_text:
3.13
Eutectix Warranty. Eutectix warrants that the Product (i) will conform to the Specifications, (ii) will be free from manufacturing
defects (including all defects in workmanship and any defects in materials that were not specified by Liquidmetal or
Customer), ) will be free and clear of all liens, encumbrances, charges, claims, or adverse interests of any kind, (iii) will comply
with, in all stages of manufacture and distribution to Liquidmetal or Customer, the terms of Section 10. The foregoing
representations and warranties shall survive delivery, inspection and payment and shall run in favor of Liquidmetal and its
Affiliates, and their respective successors, assigns and customers, both direct and indirect.
perturbation.changed_text:
3.13
Eutectix Assurance. Eutectix represents that the Product (i) will generally conform to the Specifications, (ii) may contain manufacturing
imperfections (including all defects in workmanship and any defects in materials that were not specified by Liquidmetal or
Customer), ) may not be free and clear of all liens, encumbrances, charges, claims, or adverse interests of any kind, (iii) will attempt to comply
with, in all stages of manufacture and distribution to Liquidmetal or Customer, the terms of Section 10. The foregoing
representations and assurances may not survive delivery, inspection and payment and may not run in favor of Liquidmetal and its
Affiliates, and their respective successors, assigns and customers, both direct and indirect.
perturbation.explanation: The original text provides a clear warranty, meaning that Eutectix guarantees certain qualities of the product. The modified text waters this down by changing 'Warranty' to 'Assurance', introducing vagueness with terms like 'generally conform' and 'may contain,' and negating the guarantee of being 'free and clear of all liens'. Furthermore, it suggests the warranty may not survive delivery, inspection, and payment, contradicting the standard warranty structure and creating uncertainty about its scope and duration.

perturbation.original_text:
5.4
Consequences of Termination. In the event this Agreement expires or is terminated for any reason other than a breach by
Eutectix, Liquidmetal shall purchase from Eutectix existing raw material inventory at the purchase price (including delivery
charges) paid by Eutectix to its suppliers in connection with the Orders accepted by Eutectix hereunder. Upon expiration or
termination of this Agreement:
(a) Liquidmetal shall
i.
Pay Eutectix any amounts rightfully owing under each outstanding Order in accordance with the payment terms set
forth in this Agreement;
ii.
Subject to Eutectix’s right to finish manufacturing work in process as set forth below, have the unconditional right to
possess or repossess the Licensed Equipment (as defined in Section 2.1) and take all actions it deems appropriate to
effect such possession or repossession at its own cost; and
perturbation.changed_text:
5.4
Consequences of Termination. In the event this Agreement expires or is terminated for any reason other than a breach by
Eutectix, Liquidmetal may consider purchasing from Eutectix existing raw material inventory at a reduced price (excluding delivery
charges) that Liquidmetal will solely determine and paid by Eutectix to its suppliers in connection with the Orders accepted by Eutectix hereunder. Upon expiration or
termination of this Agreement:
(a) Liquidmetal may
i.
Pay Eutectix a portion of any amounts it deems owed under each outstanding Order at Liquidmetal's discretion based on its assessment of fairness, and not necessarily in accordance with the payment terms set
forth in this Agreement;
ii.
Subject to Eutectix’s right to finish manufacturing work in process as set forth below, have the conditional right to
possess or repossess the Licensed Equipment (as defined in Section 2.1) if deemed fair by Liquidmetal and take any actions it deems appropriate to
effect such possession or repossession at Eutectix’s own cost; and
perturbation.explanation: The original text specifies a clear obligation for Liquidmetal to purchase raw material inventory at a defined price and pay amounts rightfully owing. The modified version changes 'shall purchase' to 'may consider purchasing', 'purchase price' to 'reduced price that Liquidmetal will solely determine', and 'unconditional right' to 'conditional right'. It also shifts the cost of repossession to Eutectix. This contradicts the original clause, which mandates a purchase and payment, creating significant uncertainty about Liquidmetal's obligations upon termination and opening the door for potential disputes about the value of inventory and outstanding payments.
